intro: Ophiorrhiza amnicola, commonly known as the river orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is known for its ability to thrive in wetland and riparian habitats. Ophiorrhiza amnicola is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often near rivers and streams. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
